pages.title: Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon

revisions.content:
{{About|the international set|the Japanese set|''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' (Japanese)|other uses|''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox set | image = LOB-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon | fr_name = La Légende du Dragon Blanc aux Yeux Bleus | de_name = Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon | it_name = La Leggenda del Drago Bianco Occhi Blu | ko_name = 푸른 눈의 백룡의 전설 | ko_rr_name = Pureun Nun-ui Baengnyong-ui Jeonseol | pt_name = A Lenda do Dragão Branco de Olhos Azuis | es_name = Leyenda del Dragón Blanco de Ojos Azules | type = [[Booster pack]] | series = Core Booster | size = * 126 * 103 (E, F, G, I) | cover_card = Blue-Eyes White Dragon | en_database_id = 11101000 | fr_database_id = 31101000 | de_database_id = 21101000 | it_database_id = 41101000 | pt_database_id = 11101000 | es_database_id = 51101000 | ko_database_id = 71101000 | ae_database_id = 5000000003000 | en_prefix = LOB-EN | na_prefix = LOB | eu_prefix = LOB-E | oc_prefix = LOB-A | fr_prefix = LDD-F | fc_prefix = LDD-C | de_prefix = LOB-G | it_prefix = LDD-I | pt_prefix = LDB-P | sp_prefix = LDD-S | ae_prefix = LOB | kr_prefix = LOB-K | other_sets = ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' promotional cards | ae_release_date = August 8, 2002 | kr_release_date = December 9, 2003 | en_release_date = December 1, 2004 | na_release_date = March 8, 2002 | eu_release_date = December 2002 | oc_release_date = September 2003 | fr_release_date = March 2003 | fc_release_date = July 26, 2003 | de_release_date = April 25, 2003 | it_release_date = September 12, 2003 | pt_release_date = June 2004 | sp_release_date = October 2003 | next = Metal Raiders }} '''''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon''''' is the first set of the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]''. It was first released in North America in English on March 8, 2002. The set was released in the ''Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game'' in [[English]] in [[North American English|North America]], [[European English|Europe]], [[Australian English|Oceania]], and Worldwide English; in [[French]] in Europe and [[French-Canadian|Canada]]; and in [[German]], [[Italian]], [[Portuguese]], and [[Spanish]]; in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' it was released in [[Asian-English]] and [[Korean]]. With many cards from the manga and anime series, the 126 cards in this English set were chosen from the Japanese packs ''[[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon (Japanese)|Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon]]'' and ''[[Phantom God]]'', the former of which this set is named after. These packs are prized for the rare "[[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]]" and the "[[Forbidden One]]" cards. Several of the European versions of ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' (European English, European French, German, and Italian) only contained 103 of the 126 cards present in the North American version. Many of the cards not printed in this European release of this set were later printed in the European release of ''[[Spell Ruler|Magic Ruler]]'' (for those languages). Later, Upper Deck removed the regional restriction on cards, opening up the North American card market to European collectors and players. ==History== [[Upper Deck Entertainment]] first announced "exclusive rights to market and distribute" a version of the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]''—which had already sold over 3.5 billion cards in Japan since 1999—in North America on February 11, 2002.{{cite web|url = http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/news.asp |title = Upper Deck to Deliver Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game to the U.S. market |publisher = [[Upper Deck Entertainment]] |date = February 11, 2002 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20020402182316/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/news.asp |archivedate = April 2, 2002 |accessdate = April 4, 2019}} In the press release, they announced an upcoming release of "Yu-Gi-Oh! Starter Packs [...] and nine-card Booster Packs", corresponding to ''[[Starter Deck: Yugi]]'', ''[[Starter Deck: Kaiba]]'', and ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'', to be distributed to stores on March 1. These were not the first cards printed or distributed for the ''TCG''; a different print of the ''Starter Deck: Yugi'' "[[Summoned Skull]]" had been privately distributed as a [[Summoned Skull Sample promotional card|sample card]] some time in 2001, and another different print of it had been distributed during the ''Kids' WB!'' "[[Duelin' Monsters Giveaway]]" in November 2001. The set was first released in North America in English on March 8, 2002;{{cite web|url = http://sports.upperdeck.com/news/article.aspx?aid=75&visited=1 |title = Upper Deck to Deliver Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game to the U.S. market |publisher = [[Upper Deck Entertainment]] |accessdate = November 5, 2018}}{{cite web |url = http://www.konami.co.jp/en/ir/ir-data/annualreport/report2003/pdf/all-e.pdf#page=16 |title = Annual Report 2003 |publisher = [[Konami]] |page = 14 |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20090205122004im_/http://www.konami.co.jp/en/ir/ir-data/annualreport/report2003/pdf/all-e.pdf#page=16 |archivedate = February 5, 2009 |accessdate = November 5, 2018}}{{cite magazine|last=Kohanim|first=Michael|title=SJ Cards: Decade of Dueling!|magazine=[[Shonen Jump]]|issue=110|date=April 2012|publisher=[[Viz Media]]|page=11|quote=In March 2002, the first ''Yu-Gi-Oh!'' Trading Card Game booster set was released.}}{{cite web|url = http://yugioh.anime-paradijs.com/ruilkaarten/ruilkaart-set.php?cardset_cd=LOB®ion=USA |title = Yugioh Paradijs |language = Dutch |accessdate = November 5, 2018}} in Japan in Asian-English on August 8, 2002;{{cite web|url=http://www.konami.jp/products/yugi_ocg_cg114/ |title=Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon 1st Edition |language=Japanese |publisher=[[Konami]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151022233623im_/http://www.konami.jp/products/yugi_ocg_cg114/ |archivedate=October 22, 2015 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in the United Kingdom in English in December 2002;{{cite web |url = http://www.konami.co.jp/en/ir/ir-data/annualreport/report2003/pdf/all-e.pdf#page=17 |title = Annual Report 2003 |publisher=[[Konami]] |page = 15 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090205122004im_/http://www.konami.co.jp/en/ir/ir-data/annualreport/report2003/pdf/all-e.pdf#page=17 |archivedate=February 5, 2009 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://spong.com/press_release/3992/Konami-of-Europe-announces-European-distribution-of-Yu-Gi-Oh-Trading-Card-game |title=Konami of Europe announces European distribution of Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card game |publisher=Spong |date = November 8, 2002 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in France in French in March 2003;{{cite web |url=http://www.konami-europe.com/site/html_f/news_consumer.php?id=7 |title=Yu-Gi-Oh! Le jeu de carte |language=French |publisher=[[Konami]] |date=November 29, 2002 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030205192240im_/http://www.konami-europe.com/site/html_f/news_consumer.php?id=7 |archivedate=February 5, 2003 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in Germany in German on April 25, 2003;{{cite web|url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/de/news.htm |title=Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game erscheint im April als deutsche Version |language=German |publisher=[[Upper Deck Entertainment]] |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040510090259im_/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/de/news.htm |archivedate=May 10, 2004 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}}{{cite web|url=http://www.konami-europe.com/site/html_d/news_consumer.php?id=275 |title=Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game ab heute erhältlich |language=German |publisher=[[Konami]] |date=April 25, 2003 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030827203021im_/http://www.konami-europe.com/site/html_d/news_consumer.php?id=275 |archivedate=August 27, 2003 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in Canada in French on July 26, 2003;{{cite web|url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/fc/news.asp |title=Upper Deck Entertainment et Konami Corp. lancent le premier jeu de cartes d’échange Yu-Gi-Oh! en français au Québec |trans-title=Upper Deck Entertainment and Konami Corp. launch the Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game in French in Quebec |language=French |publisher=[[Upper Deck Entertainment]] |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20030810141003im_/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com/yugioh/fc/news.asp |archivedate=August 10, 2003 |accessdate=November 26, 2015}} in Italy in Italian on September 12, 2003;{{cite web|url=http://www.e-duesse.it/index.php/News/Giocattoli/Upper-Deck-da-settembre-oltre-5-milioni-di-euro-sell-in-di-carte-Yu-gi-oh! |title=UPPER DECK: DA SETTEMBRE OLTRE 5 MILIONI DI EURO (SELL IN) DI CARTE YU-GI-OH! |language=Italian |publisher=Duesse |date = October 14, 2003 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}}{{cite web|url = http://www.lppcollecting.it/yugioh/serie.php?id=1 |title=LDD - Drago Bianco Occhi Blu |publisher=lppcollecting |language = Italian |accessdate = November 5, 2018}} in Oceania in English in September 2003;{{cite web|url=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/Upper+Deck+Entertainment+and+Konami+to+Release+Yu-Gi-Oh!+Trading+Card...-a0108098499|title=Upper Deck Entertainment and Konami to Release Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game Down Under; Yu-Gi-Oh! The World's Most Popular Trading Card Game On Store Shelves Now! |publisher=The Free Library |date = September 24, 2003 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in Spain in Spanish in October 2003;{{cite web|url=http://www.mtgmetropolis.com/yugioh/producto.asp |title=Ya está disponible a la venta la versión en español del juego |language=Spanish |publisher=Metrópolis Usera |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20031106111618im_/http://www.mtgmetropolis.com/yugioh/producto.asp |archivedate=November 6, 2003 |accessdate=November 5, 2018}} in South Korea in Korean on December 9, 2003;{{cite web|url=http://www.yugioh.co.kr/card/board.php?board=booster |title=유희왕 5D's 카드게임 공식홈페이지 |trans-title=Yugioh 5D's Card Game Official Website |language=Korean |publisher=[[Konami]] |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20140430152941im_/http://www.yugioh.co.kr/card/board.php?board=booster |archivedate=April 30, 2014 |accessdate=November 26, 2015}} and in Portugal in Portuguese in June 2004.{{cite web |title=Bem vindos à Devir Livraria |url=http://www.devir.pt/ |website=Devir |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040610163620/http:/www.devir.pt/ |archive-date=10 June 2004 |language=Portuguese |quote=Chegou Yu-Gi-Oh! em português! Já disponíveis as expansões (boosters) Predadores Metálicos e a Lenda do Dragão Branco de Olhos Azuis.}} The Portuguese release was delayed.{{cite web |title=Adiamento do Nacional |url=http://www.devir.pt/pag_index/nacional_yu.htm |website=Devir |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20040605180008/http://www.devir.pt/pag_index/nacional_yu.htm |archive-date=5 June 2004 |language=Portuguese}} On October 4, 2002, the North American set (LOB-XXX) was reprinted in the ''[[Booster Pack Collectors Tins 2002]]''. This print changed the name of "Trial of Hell" to "[[Trial of Nightmare]]", and removed the references to death from the lore of "[[Enchanting Mermaid]]", "[[Succubus Knight]]", and "[[Witty Phantom]]". On September 1, 2003, the North American set was reprinted again in the ''[[Collectible Tins 2003]]''. This print changed the term Magic Card on all cards to [[Spell Card]]. Upper Deck announced on October 14, 2003 that following this release, the Booster Packs ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'', ''[[Metal Raiders]]'', ''[[Magic Ruler]]'', ''[[Pharaoh's Servant]]'', and ''[[Labyrinth of Nightmare]]'' would be retired.{{cite web|url=http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/news.asp|title=Five Top-Selling Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game Booster Packs to Retire After 2003 Holiday Season|publisher=[[Upper Deck Entertainment]]|date=October 14, 2003|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20031205044538/http://www.upperdeckentertainment.com:80/news.asp|archivedate=December 5, 2003|accessdate=April 4, 2019}} The European (LOB-EXXX) and Spanish sets were reprinted in the ''[[Collectible Tins 2004]]'' on September 1, 2004, and a worldwide English version of the set (LOB-ENXXX) was printed on December 1, 2004 in ''[[Master Collection Volume 1]]''. In all regions, the worldwide printing included the 126 cards from the original North American release. This print introduced new [[errata]] on many cards. On October 1, 2005, the Worldwide English set (LOB-ENXXX) was reprinted in ''[[Forbidden Legacy]]''. In 2010, the North American English, European English, Oceanic English, German, and Italian sets were reprinted in ''[[Legendary Collection]]'': the German and Italian prints were released on September 30, the European and Oceanic English prints on October 1, and the North American English print on October 5. The English prints ignored the ''Master Collection Volume 1'' errata and used the errata from previous reprints, though it also introduced new errata on a few cards. The German and Italian prints included new errata on many cards. These cards were not printed with stars in their Eyes of Anubis, unlike future Legendary Collection sets, and can be challenging to differentiate from cards released in 2003 Collectible Tins. On March 15, 2011, the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean.{{ #tag: ref | Most sources seem to show the re-release happening on March 15.{{cite web | url=http://www.yugioh.co.kr/01/01_03.php | title=유희왕 제알 오피셜 카드게임 공식 홈페이지 | trans-title=Yugioh Official Card Game Official Website | lang=Korean | publisher=[[Konami]] | accessdate=December 6, 2015 | archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20140430152912im_/http://www.yugioh.co.kr/01/01_03.php | archivedate=April 30, 2014 }}{{cite web | url=http://www.daewonstyle.com/FrontStore/iGoodsView.phtml?iCategoryId=6&iCategoryIdMain=6&iGoodsId=0006_00069&iCurrentPage=8 | title=DAEWONSTYLE - 푸른 눈의 백룡의 전설 | trans-title=Daewonstyle - Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon | lang=Korean | publisher=Daewonstyle | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160317071500im_/http://www.daewonstyle.com/FrontStore/iGoodsView.phtml?iCategoryId=6&iCategoryIdMain=6&iGoodsId=0006_00069&iCurrentPage=8 | archivedate=March 17, 2016 | accessdate=November 5, 2018}} Although at least one source states it happened on March 10. | group="note" }} A coupon was included on the front flap of the box lid which could be exchanged for the [[Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon promotional cards|''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' promotional cards]]. On November 15, 2013, the North American set was reprinted in ''[[Legendary Collection: Gameboard Edition]]''. This set was reprinted again in 2014 and 2017, with packs denoting these years on their fronts. In September 2018, the European English and German sets were also reprinted in ''Legendary Collection: Gameboard Edition''. In German, the cards were reprinted with the latest errata listed on the [https://www.db.yugioh-card.com/yugiohdb/?request_locale=de official database] at the time of the release. In September 2019, the set was re-released in South Korea in Korean. Reprinted in the original box style but with black tipped packs rather than the typical blue tips. Boxes produced in 2019 and later continue to carry the 2011 date despite being printed much later. Also, the cards were printed as they were originally, in the corresponding [[Card layout]] for the time, and their texts weren't updated for erratas or changes in style, making them hard to distinguish from older cards; however they all carry stars in their Eyes of Anubis (an updated conterfeiting technique).[http://www.card09.com/goods_detail.php?goodsIdx=223 card09.com] [OCG] 푸른눈의백룡의전설 The sets continued to be printed through at least 2021. Later printings from this re-release are far darker and much more saturated than copies made in 2019, which is consistent with other sets re-released at this time including Legacy of Darkness, Pharaonic Guardian and Dark Crisis. === Identifiers === {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! scope="col" | UPC/EAN ! scope="col" | ISBN ! scope="col" | IPC ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Region ! scope="col" | Description |- | 0-53334-26441-9 | — | — | Mar 8, 2002 | North American | First Edition Hobby Cases |- | 0-53334-26442-6 | 1-931860-48-3 | — | Mar 8, 2002 | North American | First Edition Hobby Boxes |- | 0-53334-26443-3 | 1-931860-49-1 | — | Mar 8, 2002 | North American | First Edition Hobby Packs |- | 0-53334-26444-? Boxes w/ 22KRE Code on Bottom (Cards w/ Darker Ink) |- |} == Features == * As the first set in the ''Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game'', ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' introduced players to the game. * Important features and concepts introduced with this set include [[Normal Monster|Normal]], [[Effect Monster|Effect]], [[Flip monster|Flip]] and [[Fusion Monster]]s, as well as the concepts of [[Normal Summon|Normal]], [[Tribute Summon|Tribute]], and [[Fusion Summon]]ing. * It also introduced players to [[Normal Spell Card|Normal]], [[Equip Spell Card|Equip]], and [[Field Spell Card|Field]] [[Spell Card]]s, and [[Normal Trap Card|Normal]] and [[Continuous Trap Card|Continuous]] [[Trap Card]]s. Cards in this set introduced the [[Card layout#Series 3 layout|Series 3 layout]]. * Includes cards used by [[Duke Devlin]], [[Joey Wheeler]], [[Mai Valentine]], [[Maximillion Pegasus]], [[PaniK]], [[Rex Raptor]], [[Seto Kaiba]], [[Téa Gardner]], [[Weevil Underwood]], [[Yami Bakura]] and [[Yami Yugi]]. *Highly sought-after cards include the "[[Exodia]]" set, "[[Blue-Eyes White Dragon]]", "[[Dark Magician]]", "[[Swords of Revealing Light]]", "[[Dark Hole]]", "[[Raigeki]]", "[[Pot of Greed]]", "[[Tri-Horned Dragon]]", "[[Polymerization]]" and "[[Monster Reborn]]". * Unlike later sets, 23 cards were [[Comparison of North American and European Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon|omitted from the European prints]] of ''Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon'' and instead included with ''[[Magic Ruler]]''. == Breakdown == Each ''[[TCG]]'' and [[Asian-English]] pack contained 9 cards and each box contained 24 packs. Each Korean pack contained 10 cards and each box contained 30 packs. In the Korean rerelease, each pack contained 5 cards and each box contained 30 packs (40 in the 2019 version). The North American English, Oceanic English, Worldwide English, French-Canadian, Portuguese, Spanish, Asian-English, Korean and Korean re-release prints of this set contained 126 cards, including: * 2 [[Secret Rare]]s * 10 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 10 [[Super Rare]]s * 22 [[Rare]]s * 82 [[Common]]s The European English, French, German and Italian prints of this set contained 103 cards, including: * 2 Secret Rares * 10 Ultra Rares * 9 Super Rares * 17 Rares * 65 Commons ==Galleries== {{Main|Miscellaneous Gallery:Legend of Blue Eyes White Dragon}} LOB-BoosterNA.png | North American English

{{Infobox set | image = ETCO-BoosterEN.png | en_name = Eternity Code | ja_name = エターニティ・コード | romaji_name = Etāniti Kōdo | fr_name = Le Code de l'Éternité | de_name = Eternity Code | it_name = Codice Eternità | ko_name = 이터니티 코드 | ko_rr_name = Iteoniti Kodeu | pt_name = Código da Eternidade | es_name = Código de Eternidad | type = [[Booster Pack]] | series = Core Booster | prefix = ETCO | order_number = | size = * 80 (''OCG'') * 101 (''TCG'') | cover_card = Accesscode Talker | ja_database_id = 1122003 | ko_database_id = 71118001 | database_id = 11119003 | premiere = yes | jp_release_date = January 11, 2020 | kr_release_date = April 14, 2020 | na_release_date = June 5, 2020 | eu_release_date = April 30, 2020 | oc_release_date = April 30, 2020 | fr/de/it/sp_release_date = April 30, 2020 | pt_release_date = April 30, 2020 | prev = Ignition Assault | next = Rise of the Duelist }} '''''Eternity Code''''' is a [[Core Booster]] in the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game]]'' (''OCG'') and ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game]]'' (''TCG''). It is the twelfth and final main set of [[Series 10]], following ''[[Ignition Assault]]'', as well as the final set revolving around ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS]]''. In North America, this set was originally scheduled to be released on May 1, 2020. However, due to restrictions imposed in the State of Texas in response to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]] impacting manufacturers of the ''Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Card Game'', its release was delayed until June 5, 2020.{{cite web |title=Measures taken by the State of Texas to prevent the spread of infection have temporarily impacted the operations of one of our product manufacturers. As a result, the distribution, Premiere! event (originally set for April 25–26) and official release (originally slated for May 1) of Eternity Code have been delayed. No other products are currently affected. |url=https://www.yugioh-card.com/en/news/news_2020_ETCO_notice.html |website=Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME |access-date=January 31, 2021 |date=April 3, 2020}} ==Features== * Includes cards used by [[Yusaku Fujiki|Playmaker]], [[Cal Kolter]], [[Theodore Hamilton|Soulburner]], [[George Gore]], [[Skye Zaizen|Blue Maiden]], [[Roken Kogami]], [[Ai]], and [[Akira Zaizen]]. ** The ''TCG'' version also includes cards used by [[Yuya Sakaki (manga)|Yuya Sakaki]] and [[Yusei Fudo]]. * Introduces new members/[[support]] for the "[[@Ignister]]", "[[A.I.]]", "[[Ancient Warriors]]", "[[Code Talker (archetype)|Code Talker]]", "[[Charmer]]", "[[Cyber]]", "[[Dragonmaid]]", "[[Evil Eye]]", "[[Evolution Pill]]", "[[Familiar-Possessed]]", "[[Generaider]]", "[[Gouki]]", "[[Hole]]", "[[Infernoid]]", "[[Infinitrack]]", "[[Invoked]]", "[[Madolche]]", "[[Marincess]]", "[[Megalith]]", "[[Mekk-Knight]]", "[[Orcust]]", "[[Polymerization (archetype)|Polymerization]]", "[[Resonator]]", "[[roid]]", "[[Salamangreat]]", "[[Thunder Dragon]]", "[[Tindangle]]", "[[Traptrix]]", "[[Unchained]]", "[[Void]]", "[[Witchcrafter]]", "[[World Legacy]]", and "[[Xyz (archetype)|Xyz]]" [[archetype]]s; as well as the [[Cataclysmic]], [[Deep Sea]], [[Gizmek]], and [[Yo-kai Girl]] [[series]]. ** The ''[[TCG]]'' version also introduces members/support that are new to the ''TCG'' for the "[[Machina]]", "[[Performapal]]", "[[Plunder Patroll]]", and "[[Superheavy Samurai]]" archetypes. * Introduces the "[[Codebreaker]]" and "[[Nemeses]]" archetypes. * Introduces the first support for the "[[Barbaros]]" archetype. ** Also introduces the first support for the "[[Superheavy Samurai Soul]]" archetype to the ''TCG''. ==Breakdown== In the ''[[OCG]]'', there are 5 cards per pack and 30 packs per box. The set contains 80 cards, the [[Master Set]] consists of 119 in Japanese or 103 in Korean: * 1 [[Holographic Rare]] (also available as Ultra Rare, Secret Rare, 20th Secret Rare and Ultimate Rare) * 6 [[Ultimate Rare]] * 16 [[20th Secret Rare]] (Japanese only) * 16 [[Secret Rare]] * 6 [[Ultra Rare]]s (also available as Ultimate Rare, Secret Rare, and 20th Secret Rare) * 10 [[Super Rare]]s (also available as Secret Rare and 20th Secret Rare) * 18 [[Rare]]s * 46 [[Common]]s In the ''[[TCG]]'', there are 9 cards per pack and 24 packs per box. The set contains 101 cards: * 5 [[Starlight Rare]]s * 10 [[Secret Rare]]s * 14 [[Ultra Rare]]s * 26 [[Super Rare]]s * 50 [[Common]]s ==Galleries== ETCO-BoosterEN.png | English
